cluster_relations.rel_desc: The mysteries of black holes are unresolved questions specifically about black holes.

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in the context of astrophysics and cosmology

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Some of the mysteries of black holes are specifically about how they form.
The mysteries of black holes also relate to their physical properties.
The study of black holes is a research activity focused on black holes themselves.

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: Field exists to reduce uncertainty about black holes

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The general public is fascinated and captivated by black holes.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: General Public Interested in Black Holes

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay 'The Mystery of Black Holes' discusses black holes.
The essay will discuss the formation of black holes.
The essay will also discuss the properties of black holes.
The essay will discuss the mysteries of black holes and efforts to unravel them.
The concept of the existence of black holes refers to black holes as real cosmic entities.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., question, mystery, study, document, or concept) is about, concerns, or focuses on the object topic or phenomenon.
args.justification: All these relations describe an aboutness/topical link where a mystery, study, essay, or conceptual statement is explicitly about black holes, their formation, properties, or existence. Normalizing 'concerns', 'focuses_on', 'discusses', and 'pertains_to' into a single predicate 'is_about' yields a consistent topical relation in the KG.

Each relation links a subject (mystery, study, essay, or conceptual proposition) to the topic it is about, which fits a shared class of topical/aboutness relations rather than compositional, causal, or hierarchical links.
The primary semantic dimension for all these links is aboutness (topic-of, concerns, discusses), not causality, composition, or spatiality, so they belong in an ABOUTNESS group.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject experiences fascination or strong interest directed toward the object.
args.justification: This relation captures an affective/attitudinal stance of the general public toward black holes, which is distinct from topical aboutness and is best modeled as an affective predicate.

The link describes an emotional or attitudinal reaction (fascination) of an audience toward a phenomenon, fitting an affective-attitude relation class rather than topical, causal, or compositional classes.
The dominant semantic dimension is emotional/affective engagement (fascination), so it belongs in an AFFECTIVE group instead of ABOUTNESS or ASSOCIATION.
